channel.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
channel.description:
Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user/tor-browser_en-US/Browser/update.test Denied: c Logfile: /var/log/kern.log For more information, please see: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingApparmor
and this message also appeared when i wanted to download from tor , (just wanted to test that and it happened the message did appeared) and i couldnt download the file.
btw the message different from this one (which is my old post with same operation "mknod") :-
https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,1018.0.html?PHPSESSID=gorirejjmo8c9m1si0n6eu6ncvirb68p
also i saw the same profile path in this wiki:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/AppArmor/Tor_Browser_Bundle
but i didnt c it as an apparmor message popping up in whonix b4.

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Awesome. Works great. Package upgrade soon.

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: troubadour
item.description:
I did reproduce the denied message, although with a completely different file (a long chain of alphanumeric characters).

The message has nothing to do with the issue.

After installation, the downloads preference is set to “Always ask me where to save files”. The default downloads directory is “~/tor-browser_en-US/Browser/Downloads”.

Reflected the change in the profile, modified permissions in Browser directory, it should work.
https://github.com/troubadoour/apparmor-profile-torbrowser/commit/295e1aee5a9e2148b5d8c73cbd8f9d6d986b6f3a

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I can confirm "etc/fstab" too. It happened on a download, has gone after the last update.
Yes, added the updated package to the repository.
"deny /etc/fstab r," is fine.
Great.
I cannot reproduce "redacted-some-id", whatever the page I save. Wondering where that comes from, a file without a parent directory. Is it showing consistently?
Yes. TBB stable and alpha. Cannot save any page nor I can save any file.

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: troubadour
item.description:
I can confirm “etc/fstab” too. It happened on a download, has gone after the last update. “deny /etc/fstab r,” is fine.

I cannot reproduce “redacted-some-id”, whatever the page I save. Wondering where that comes from, a file without a parent directory. Is it showing consistently?

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
[quote=“Patrick, post:16, topic:1005”][quote author=z link=topic=1129.msg7735#msg7735 date=1428869588]
Also when the screen opens to choose the download directory it denies operation to open /etc/fstab
[/quote]

I can confirm that one in Whonix build version 10.0.0.5.0.

Apr 12 23:13:52 host kernel: [ 4910.318614] type=1400 audit(1428880432.349:27): apparmor="DENIED" operation="open" parent=12590 profile="/home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox" name="/etc/fstab" pid=12609 comm="firefox" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=1000 ouid=0

Fixed that one:

github.com/Whonix/apparmor-profile-torbrowser

fixes

committed 09:21AM - 14 Apr 15 UTC
adrelanos
+10 -7

@troubadour can you please review? (Using “deny /etc/fstab r,”)

[quote=“Patrick, post:17, topic:1005”]Another one.

Apr 12 23:16:14 host kernel: [ 5052.483807] type=1400 audit(1428880574.513:28): apparmor="DENIED" operation="mkdir" parent=12590 profile="/home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox" name=redacted-some-id pid=12609 comm="firefox" requested_mask="c" denied_mask="c" fsuid=1000 ouid=1000

Tor Browser version 4.0.8. Happens when trying to safe the default homepage to a file. Menu -> File -> Page Save As. Something we need to fix for the next testers-only version.[/quote]
I don’t know how to fix that one. troubadour, can you try to save files please and try fixing that one?

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Another one.

Tor Browser version 4.0.8. Happens when trying to safe the default homepage to a file. Menu -> File -> Page Save As. Something we need to fix for the next testers-only version.

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
i dont think this command is correct (or i got it right):-

but i have tried this in whonix 9.6 worksation:-

dpkg -l grep

and the following came up:-

Desired=Uknow/Install/Remove/Purge/Hold | Status=Not/Inst/Conf-files/Unpacked/halF-conf/Half-inst/trig-await/Trig-pend |/ Err?=(none) /Reinst-required (Status,Err: uppercase=bad) ||/ Name Version Architecture Description +++-========-==========-============-============= ii grep 2.12.2 i386 GNU grep, egrep and fgrep

also regarding apparmor profile in whonix 9.6 gateway:-

the following came up:-

Desired=Uknow/Install/Remove/Purge/Hold | Status=Not/Inst/Conf-files/Unpacked/halF-conf/Half-inst/trig-await/Trig-pend |/ Err?=(none) /Reinst-required (Status,Err: uppercase=bad) ||/ Name Version Architecture Description +++-========-==========-============-============= ii apparmor- 3:1.4-1 all AppArmor profile for profile The Tor Browser Bu

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
also how can i have apparmor without changing to tester repository?
Install the package from source code. https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Dev/Build_Documentation/apparmor-profile-torbrowser
GitHub

Whonix/apparmor-profile-torbrowser

AppArmor profile for The Tor Browser Bundle (TBB) - https://www.whonix.org/wiki/AppArmor - for better security (hardening). - Whonix/apparmor-profile-torbrowser

if might be any mistake in what i did from changing the repositories then how can i make sure im using tester repository or its working efficiently but not other repositories?
syntax: [code]dpkg -l | grep pkg-name[/code]

example:

dpkg -l | apparmor-profile-torbrowser

Compare with:

github.com

Whonix/apparmor-profile-torbrowser/blob/master/debian/changelog

apparmor-profile-torbrowser (3:6.8-1) unstable; urgency=medium

  * New upstream version (local package).

 -- Patrick Schleizer <adrelanos@riseup.net>  Thu, 16 Apr 2020 12:25:23 +0000

apparmor-profile-torbrowser (3:6.7-1) unstable; urgency=medium

  * New upstream version (local package).

 -- Patrick Schleizer <adrelanos@riseup.net>  Thu, 02 Apr 2020 11:36:54 +0000

apparmor-profile-torbrowser (3:6.6-1) unstable; urgency=medium

  * New upstream version (local package).

 -- Patrick Schleizer <adrelanos@riseup.net>  Wed, 01 Apr 2020 14:28:57 +0000

apparmor-profile-torbrowser (3:6.5-1) unstable; urgency=medium
This file has been truncated. show original

Compare if relevant file https://github.com/Whonix/apparmor-profile-torbrowser/blob/master/etc/apparmor.d/home..tor-browser_.Browser.firefox matches with the corresponding one on your hdd.

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: z11
item.description:
I get mknod message on an updated Workstation 9.6 with Tor Browser 4.5a5 installed.

The default download folder of the browser is /home/user/tor-browser_en-US/Browser/Downloads and it denies with mknod message.

Also when the screen opens to choose the download directory it denies operation to open /etc/fstab

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
this one i got it without using any updater just i was trying to download paltalk to c if its going to leak the ip or not (installing it in wine environment because it doesnt support linux porting yet from what i saw from their website).

mkdir operation this one:-
https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,1135.0.html

i have got it from tor updater.

also how can i have apparmor without changing to tester repository?

if might be any mistake in what i did from changing the repositories then how can i make sure im using tester repository or its working efficiently but not other repositories?

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
I speculate you are getting this issue when trying to update using Tor Browser’s internal updater?

The problem is, you may not be “really” using the testers repository. Perhaps and outdated version of it. Until https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,1131.msg7722.html#msg7722 is fixed, all other bug reports are invalid.

Read full topic

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
well i dont know how to be more specific , but there is a notification button on the left down side of the screen in whonix, when i press on it , it shows the notifications from apparmor; so from there i copied the message and put it here.

and yes i still c it , and without any conditions just when i open whonix.

its not in whonix 10 , its in whonix 9.6 with tester repository

also i dont know why mknod problems look always strange lol

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: troubadour

Looks strange. Could you be more specific on the conditions you saw the first message? Do you still see it?

Which Whonix version are you using? The download issue is fixed in Whonix 10.

item.title: Profile: /home/*/tor-browser_*/Browser/firefox Operation: mknod Name: /home/user

item.description:
Profile: /home//tor-browser_/Browser/firefox
Operation: mknod
Name: /home/user/tor-browser_en-US/Browser/update.test
Denied: c
Logfile: /var/log/kern.log
For more information, please see:
https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingApparmor

and this message also appeared when i wanted to download from tor , (just wanted to test that and it happened the message did appeared) and i couldnt download the file.

btw the message different from this one (which is my old post with same operation “mknod”) :-

https://www.whonix.org/forum/index.php/topic,1018.0.html?PHPSESSID=gorirejjmo8c9m1si0n6eu6ncvirb68p
